title: Union Minister Shivraj Singh Chauhan graces Janpratinidhi Sammelan in Agartala
content: The event saw inauguration of various rural development projects and beneficiary felicitation programmes

title: PM Narendra Modi’s foreign visits cost ₹462 crores in 2021-25
content: Travel to the U.S. accounts for 16% of total foreign visit expenditure in the period; Japan and France follow at nearly 9% each

title: Villagers skip meeting convened by Odisha govt over Anganwadi boycott row
content: For past three months, villagers have stopped sending their children to Anganwadi Centre where Dalit woman was appointed as helper-cum-cook

title: Antimicrobial resistance: Charles Darwin was right; India’s drug policy isn’t
content: Antibiotics aren’t only pharmacological agents: they are evolutionary interventions that reshape microbial populations wherever they are deployed

title: Delhi High Court asks Centre to respond to plea on ‘surge’ in missing person cases
content: The petition, filed by an NGO, states that there is an “unprecedented crisis” in Delhi, with reports of more than 800 persons going missing in the first 15 days of this year

title: Anna University inaugurates state-of-the-art AI lab
content: Housed at the Technology Research Park at the University, the lab will serve as a hub for research projects, internships, workshops, hackathons, and industry-driven certification programmes

title: U.P. budget 2026: BJP’s farewell budget, lacks focus, says Opposition
content: Samajwadi Party president Akhilesh Yadav alleged that the government has not been able to spend even 50% of the previous budget so far; Congress demands white paper on project and proposal implementation

title: West Bengal BJP welcomes MHA directive of singing all stanzas of Vande Mataram
content: State BJP president Samik Bhattacharya said that it is most unfortunate if someone smells communalism in Goddess Durga

title: Protest against Ken-Betwa river link project turns violent in M.P.; 3 cases lodged
content: Locals from various villages were protesting for various demands, including the release of AAP leader Amit Bhatnagar and better compensation and rehabilitation for those affected by the project, says police

title: Haryana citizens send 11,000 suggestions to govt.’s AI-based portal for State budget
content: Suggestions concerning local self-governance or municipalities and panchayats topped the list at 750, followed by 450 on infrastructure development, and 200 on education, skill development, and employment

title: Salman Khan’s brother-in-law Aayush Sharma gets threat email
content: The sender of the email to Aayush Sharma, who is also an actor, claimed he was a member of the Lawrence Bishnoi gang, they said, without providing further details

title: KMRL gets nod to seek ₹1016-cr. loan for Kochi metro phase-2
content: Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank to offer assistance for the project; second phase will be completed in a time-bound manner, says Minister

title: Silk saree production hit in Kancheepuram
content: Since weavers did not get zari, they were unable to weave silk sarees and have not gotten their wages for over two months now

title: Kadalukku Oru Kaditham: when the sea waits for letters
content: The Directorate of Public Libraries has set up an ocean station for marine awareness; members of the public can post letters anonymously, expressing their feelings, in an effort create a connection with nature

title: Karnataka Revenue Department makes plea to High Court
content: The Revenue Department has made a proposal to the Karnataka High Court, urging it to take up auto entry of court orders in RTCs on the lines of revenue courts

title: Karnataka High Court defers cross-examination of witnesses in murder case to prevent exposure of defence strategy
content: In a ruling reinforcing fair trial rights of the accused persons in criminal cases, the Karnataka High Court has directed a trial court to defer cross-examination of a prime witness in a murder case till the examination of remaining witnesses ‘to prevent exposure of the defence strategy that may enable other witnesses to tailor their testimony’

title: Supreme Court adjourns hearing in case against T.N. CM Stalin’s 2011 poll win
content: It found a lack of structure in presentation of material particulars in Saidai Duraisamy’s pleadings accusing M.K. Stalin of corruption ahead of the 2011 Assembly poll from the Kolathur constituency

title: Supreme Court agrees to list another plea against Assam CM for alleged hate speeches
content: The petition alleged that Himanta Biswa Sarma had repeatedly made statements that incite discrimination, social and economic boycotts and violence against Bengali-origin Muslims in Assam

title: Over 13 crore disbursed for students under VIT’s scholarship scheme: Chancellor
content: On the occasion, Deputy Speaker of Tamil Nadu Legislative Assembly and chief guest K. Pitchandi distributed scholarships worth ₹28 lakh to 242 meritorious students

title: APSRTC to induct 750 electric buses in GCC mode; staff union flays move
content: Tenders for civil works at the proposed e-Bus depots are being released and the construction is likely to begin within one and a half months, says official

title: Tribal hamlets atop Jarthankollai hillock in Vellore get first bitumen road
content: DRDA officials say that the new bitumen stretch is laid between Thellai and Jarthankollai villages on the hills at a cost of ₹14.99 crore

title: Three bridges across Cheyyar river near Chengam, Polur towns inaugurated
content: The new bridges will end a detour of at least 20 kms for residents in surrounding farming villages to reach nearest towns like Polur, Arani, Chengam, and Tiruvannamalai

title: Over 800 Haj pilgrims vaccinated in Vellore, nearby districts
content: The initiative, which will be completed in these districts by Friday, is being done in coordination with the State and district Haj committees

title: A.P. Discoms told to ensure uninterrupted power supply during Sivaratri festival
content: Energy Minister asks officials to carry out preventive maintenance checks of feeders, transformers, and distribution lines to avoid power breakdowns

title: Education Ministry pushes for AI-led teaching and learning at all levels by next academic year
content: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan met with leaders of 10 leading start-ups using AI in the ed-tech sector at a roundtable discussion in IIT Delhi, ahead of the government’s Bharat Bodhan AI Conclave starting December 11

title: Brain-dead engineering student’s organs give new lease of life to several patients
content: Family consents to donation after accident; heart, liver, kidneys, lungs and corneas transplanted across Vijayawada, Guntur and Hyderabad

title: Tamil Brahmi inscriptions found in Egypt’s Valley of the Kings shed light on ancient trade links
content: Indian visitors seem to have followed an existing practice of leaving their names inside the tombs, researchers say

title: Praja Arogya Vedika seeks higher health outlay in 2026-27 Budget
content: PAV urges Ministers to raise health allocation to 2.5% of GSDP and provide an additional ₹20,000 to ₹25,000 crore, with emphasis on primary care, tribal health and strengthening publicly funded services

title: Bangladesh polls: Why India is watching closely
content: Bangladesh votes Thursday in an election with significant implications for India. With Sheikh Hasina out, India hopes the frontrunner BNP can reset ties, despite historical friction. A tight contest is expected between the BNP alliance and a bloc led by Jamaat-e-Islami. India also eyes a constitutional referendum and key security concerns, including insurgent groups and Chinese influence.

title: 'Stabbed them repeatedly': US-returned Bengaluru techie kills parents in villa over startup funding
content: A US-returned techie, Rohan Chandra Bhat, has been arrested for allegedly murdering his parents in their Bengaluru villa. Driven by desperation to fund his new venture, Rohan reportedly stabbed his retired navy captain father and dentist mother after heated arguments over financial support. Neighbours alerted authorities, but the couple was declared dead at the hospital.

title: Bumrah yorker hits Ishan, Sanju Samson on standby for Abhishek
content: Jasprit Bumrah showed good form in training, boosting hopes for his return against Namibia. Ishan Kishan faced a brief scare after being hit by a Bumrah yorker but resumed batting. Sanju Samson is in contention if Abhishek Sharma's stomach infection persists. Washington Sundar also trained well. The team is preparing for the Pakistan clash.

title: 'I quit, as ChatGPT-maker...': Top researcher Zoe Hitzig at Sam Altman's company
content: OpenAI's top researcher Zoe Hitzig resigned, citing concerns over the company's decision to test ads in ChatGPT. She warned that the vast trove of private user data collected by ChatGPT could be exploited for manipulation, drawing parallels to Facebook's past privacy issues. Hitzig proposed alternative models for AI companies to avoid such pitfalls.

title: 'Gave poisoned laddoos': How ‘mystical healer’ preyed on greed and left a trail of deaths in Delhi
content: A 72-year-old occultist, Kamruddin, has been arrested for allegedly poisoning three people with laddoos in Delhi. Cops describe him as a habitual offender with a criminal history in Uttar Pradesh and Rajasthan, including at least two prior murder cases. He preyed on victims by promising mystical solutions and wealth, extorting money before administering poison.

title: From IND vs PAK in 2007 to AFG vs SA in 2026: All tied matches in T20 World Cup
content: South Africa secured a dramatic victory over Afghanistan in a thrilling double super over T20 World Cup encounter. After both teams tied at 187 in regulation and again in the first super over, South Africa ultimately prevailed in the second sudden-death showdown. Afghanistan's hopes were dashed when Rahmanullah Gurbaz was caught off the final ball.

title: ICC T20 World Cup 2026: Full match schedule for February 12
content: The T20 World Cup heats up on February 12 with Sri Lanka facing Oman, Nepal taking on Italy, and India battling Namibia. Sri Lanka, despite Hasaranga's injury, aims for another win. Nepal, buoyed by a near-upset against England, meets Italy. India, after defeating USA, faces Namibia with opener Sharma a doubt, potentially seeing Samson open.

title: A year after 5-day office mandate, some JPMorgan staff fear ‘career’ petition
content: America's largest bank mandated a five-day return to office in March 2025, sparking an employee petition and internal backlash. CEO Jamie Dimon dismissed the petition, emphasizing the policy's necessity for clients and the company, despite acknowledging remote work's potential for some roles and individuals.

title: James Van Der Beek passes away at 48 after battle with colorectal cancer
content: US actor James Van Der Beek, the star of the American TV series "Dawson's Creek," died on Wednesday at age 48 after a battle with colorectal cancer.  While he also had roles in the films "Varsity Blues" and "The Rules of Attraction," Van Der Beek never truly established himself in cinema as he struggled to separate himself from the legacy of "Dawson's Creek."

title: Woman constable ditches cop fiance hours before wedding, elopes with history-sheeter
content: A constable's wedding plans were disrupted when she vanished the night before her marriage. Her father alleged abduction by a history-sheeter. However, the bride was found and stated she left on her own. The groom has called off the wedding. The bride remains firm in her decision. She will be produced before a court.

title: Erika Kirk addresses backlash as Bad Bunny’s show outshines TPUSA event
content: Erika Kirk spoke out after Turning Point USA aired its alternative Super Bowl LX halftime show honoring her late husband, Charlie Kirk. The broadcast featured a tribute montage and patriotic performances, claiming millions of viewers despite streaming restrictions. While Bad Bunny headlined the official NFL show, the rival event blended politics, grief, and culture into a deeply emotional night.

title: Connor McDavid’s wife Lauren Kyle turns heads in Milan ahead of Olympic opener
content: Connor McDavid and Team Canada have arrived in Milan for the 2026 Winter Olympics, beginning preparations for their opener against Czechia. McDavid skated on the top line in practice and shared candid remarks about the Olympic Village and adjusting to jet lag. Off the ice, Lauren Kyle’s Instagram posts offered fans a personal look at life in Milan, highlighting family support and national pride. Canada, led by captain Sidney Crosby, aims to build on last year’s international success as Olympic competition begins.

title: Knicks vs 76ers injury report: Who’s playing, out and questionable
content: The Knicks and 76ers clash on February 11, 2026, impacting Eastern Conference standings. New York, near the top, faces Philadelphia battling for playoff positioning. Both teams are hampered by injuries, with key players like OG Anunoby out for the Knicks and Joel Embiid a game-time decision for the 76ers. This crucial matchup could hinge on depth and rebounding.

title: Happy Hug Day 2026: Top 50 wishes, messages and quotes for your special someone
content: The article offers over 75 messages, quotes, and greetings for partners, friends, family, and long-distance loved ones, highlighting hugs as a powerful, simple way to express care and make others feel cherished.

title: 'Border 2' box office Day 20 and Day 21 (LIVE): Sunny starrer beats Rs 432 crore mark globally
content: 'Border 2', which kicked off with an impressive bang during the Republic Day celebrations, is now seeing a decline in its box office draw as it enters week three. Despite the stirring performance of Sunny Deol and a hefty total of Rs 316 crore in India, totaling Rs 432.1 crore globally, recent ticket sales reflect a waning interest among audiences.

title: US-Israel meeting: Trump backs Iran talks, warns Tehran citing 'Midnight Hammer'
content: US President Donald Trump met with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, emphasizing the need for continued negotiations with Iran on a nuclear deal. Trump warned Tehran of severe consequences if talks falter, referencing past US military actions. The leaders also addressed the Gaza conflict and broader Middle East instability, with international calls for restraint amid regional tensions.

title: Bihar ‘pakadua vivah’: Student kidnapped by friends, drugged, forced into marriage
content: In a shocking incident from Samastipur, a 22-year-old student named Nitish Kumar was said to have been drugged and abducted by those he considered acquaintances. For two harrowing days, he was reportedly held against his will after being sedated.

title: Look forward to getting more new-gen jets: IAF vice chief
content: The Indian Air Force is looking to induct more multi-role fighter aircraft, with Rafale being a strong contender, as stated by Air Marshal Nagesh Kapoor. This comes ahead of a Defence Acquisition Council meeting that may clear deals for Rafale jets and P-8I aircraft.

title: Govt proposes new defence acquisition procedure aligned with evolving geo-strategic landscape
content: The government has proposed the Defence Acquisition Procedure (DAP)-2026 to align India's defence procurement with evolving geo-strategic needs, economic growth, and technological advancements. This new policy aims to accelerate acquisition, boost domestic manufacturing, and promote jointness and integration within the armed forces.

title: Alix Earle hints at rumored romance with Tom Brady as insiders reveal what happened between the two
content: Tom Brady and Alix Earle have sparked major romance rumors ever since the two were spotted standing close at a New Year's Eve party in St. Barths. Since then, while the two kept things private, they were again spotted dancing at a recent Super Bowl party. While this has sparked chaos among fans, Alix Earle hinted at what might have happened.

title: 'Shoe-beating' remark sparks uproar in J&K assembly, BJP demands Omar apology
content: Jammu and Kashmir assembly proceedings were disrupted after Chief Minister Omar Abdullah's remarks about BJP legislators being "shoe-beaten" by Union Home Minister Amit Shah. Opposition members protested and walked out, demanding an apology from Abdullah, who refused, stating his comments targeted the legislators and not individuals.

title: Two boys, aged 13 and 12, in hospital after being stabbed in class at London school
content: Counter-terrorism police are investigating an "American-style" stabbing at Kingsbury High School where two boys, aged 12 and 13, were injured. A 13-year-old former pupil was arrested on suspicion of attempted murder after allegedly climbing over a wall and entering a science lesson. Both injured boys are in serious but stable condition.

title: T20 World Cup: Motie magic sinks England in Mumbai
content: England were bowled out for 166 in 19 overs in reply. They began the chase quickly, but Motie, who mixes left-arm orthodox and wrist spin, dismissed Tom Banton, Jacob Bethell and captain Harry Brook in a spell of 3 for 33.

title: Op Sindoor: Didn't strike N-site in Pak's Kirana Hills, says Vice Air Chief
content: The Indian Air Force confirmed targeting terror infrastructure and military installations in Pakistan during Operation Sindoor, explicitly denying any strikes on the Kirana Hills nuclear site. Vice Chief of Air Staff Air Marshal Nagesh Kapoor stated that any videos showing attacks on Kirana Hills were not from IAF operations, emphasizing their focus on identified terror and military targets.

title: Sky's the Limit? Suryakumar Yadav sees no ceiling to India's T20 World Cup title defence
content: Captain Suryakumar Yadav led India to a 29-run victory over the USA in their T20 World Cup opener, scoring an unbeaten 84. He emphasized prioritizing team goals and fostering open communication for continued success. India aims to defend their title, with Yadav confident in the team's preparation and ability to go all the way.

title: 'Stuttering in anger': Cong attacks Puri over Epstein links, poses 6 questions
content: Congress has intensified its criticism of Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri regarding his alleged connections with financier Jeffrey Epstein. Party leader Pawan Khera questioned Puri's interactions, citing an email exchange suggesting Epstein facilitated a meeting with Reid Hoffman. Khera also condemned Puri's remarks on Epstein's conviction, accusing him of trivializing child sexual exploitation and demanding moral clarity from public officials.

title: More US, Venezuelan crude to flow into India? Economic viability in doubt
content: Practical constraints limit the scale at which Indian refiners can replace existing supplies with oil from the United States or Venezuela. US crude is typically light and sweet, meaning it has lower sulphur content, while many Indian refineries are configured to process medium-grade crude.

title: Bank strike on February 12: Will banks remain open or closed tomorrow? Why bank unions are striking
content: Bank unions across India have announced a nationwide strike on February 12, protesting the government's new Labour Codes.  Customers face uncertainty as major banks warn of potential operational disruptions, though they are making arrangements for smooth functioning. Unions also advocate for improved work-life balance and a five-day work week.

title: Rajpal Yadav's wife Radha breaks silence on his case: 'Everyone has stood by him'
content: Actor-comedian Rajpal Yadav surrendered to Tihar Jail over cheque-bounce cases totaling nearly ₹9 crore. His wife, Radha, revealed the film fraternity, including Sonu Sood, Guru Randhawa, and Mika Singh, has rallied behind him, offering financial and moral support. Several prominent industry figures have also reached out, promising assistance.

title: Cartel drones, military activity: Chaos at US border town after airspace shut, then reopened
content: The FAA has imposed a 10-day flight restriction over El Paso International Airport and parts of southern New Mexico due to "special security reasons." All flights are grounded, with the federal government warning of potential deadly force against any aircraft violating the restricted airspace. Officials expressed surprise and lack of clear information regarding the unprecedented shutdown.

title: Ahead of March 31 deadline, Odisha revises surrender and rehabilitation scheme for surrendering Maoists
content: After revision of guideline in November last year that saw reward money going up substantially, 45 LWEs have surrendered before security forces while there are still 40 cadres including a State Committee Member active in Odisha

title: Amid Naravane memoir row, Defence Ministry plans fresh norms
content: The proposed guidelines for serving, retired armed forces personnel, who wish to publish books in future, will spell out the process to be followed before any manuscript is cleared for publication

title: Calling Rafale the ‘hero’ of Operation Sindoor, Vice Chief of Air Staff seeks more fighter planes for IAF
content: IAF looking to induct more new generation multi-role fighter aircraft into its fleet, says Air Marshal Kapoor; Vayu Shakti exercise at Pokhran range this month to showcase IAF’s air assets and firepower

title: Supreme Court orders completion of AAIB probe into AI-171 flight crash in three weeks
content: Air India Flight 171 crash at the Ahmedabad airport killed 12 crew members and 229 passengers on June 12 last year

title: Vande Mataram to be played before Jana Gana Mana, says Centre to States and government bodies
content: The fresh set of guidelines were uploaded on the MHA’s website on February 6 but no formal announcement or a statement was issued; it states that whenever the official version, around 3.10 minutes long, is sung or played, the audience shall stand to attention

title: Two separate landmine explosions leave soldier, civilian injured in J&K
content: An anti-personnel landmine went off at forward post Faulad, close to the LoC, in Gulmarg Sector in Baramulla; an older, similar device exploded in Poonch

title: Gunadala Matha annual fete concludes amid huge turnout
content: Solemn Eucharistic celebration marks final day as Bishop calls for equality and leaders assure development of shrine on par with Velankanni

title: Trade impact, memorials among issues raised in Rajya Sabha
content: In the Rajya Sabha, members demanded curbs on Korean mobile games, right to recall elected representatives, and Constitutional status to the National Commission for Minorities. They also discussed the impact of the India-U.S. trade deal on soybean farmers in Madhya Pradesh.

title: Bacteria can talk to each other and are multilingual, says biologist
content: The award winning scientist believes our understanding of bacterial behaviour can help in creating new therapies

title: Sharmila terms Governor’s Budget address hollow and directionless
content: PCC chief says speech repackaged manifesto, masked 19 months of governance failures and made inflated claims on investments, jobs and welfare schemes

title: Speaker can expunge any unparliamentary language, says J&K CM Omar Abdullah
content: CM apologises for his earlier remarks implying that BJP legislators had been reprimanded by the Union Home Minister, triggering an Opposition protest; CM apologises, but lashes out at LoP for his criticism of NC founder Sheikh Abdullah

title: BMTC to set up EV battery swapping stations at bus terminals across Bengaluru
content: The BMTC has identified multiple locations across the city, including Shantinagar, Domlur TTMC, Malleshwaram, Yelahanka New Town, Nagarbhavi and Vidyaranyapura, with spaces ranging from 120 to 250 sq. ft.

title: Union Minister Hardeep Puri acknowledges Epstein meetings, says Rahul Gandhi indulging in ‘innuendo, smear campaign’
content: The Union Minister said his interactions with Epstein had nothing to do with the crimes and that he had apprised Rahul Gandhi by sending a "note" last year

title: Amid heated debate, banter between Opposition and Chair
content: Leader of the Opposition in the Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi responded gamely to the Chair of the House, the BJP’s Jagdambika Pal, who was formerly with the Congress

title: Karnataka introduces online scrutiny to prevent revenue courts from admitting cases beyond their jurisdiction
content: The government has put in place a 15-point online screening measure to prevent revenue courts from overstepping their jurisdiction

title: Curtains go up for VAIGA 2026 fest at Anayara World Market
content: Agriculture Minister underscores need for value addition in agriculture for enhancing incomes and says ryots and farmer collectives need to concentrate on entrepreneurship for making farming profitable

title: Municipal polling peaceful across the State, counting tomorrow
content: According to the State Election Commission sources, 73.01% of votes were polled. It is worth noting that the Gram Panchayat (rural local bodies) elections held in December 2025 recorded a voter turnout of over 85%

title: A.P. Food Commission member inspects anganwadi centres, issues show-cause notices
content: Lakshmi Reddy Endela directs CDPOs to issue show-cause notices to employees of Medarametla and Bodduvanipalem anganwadi centres

title: Delhi HC seeks production, sales details from Rapsodia in Anupama Dayal copyright suit
content: The Indian designer has alleged unauthorised duplication of her copyrighted works by Argentinian brand Rapsodia

title: Ravi Pillai academic scholarship will pave the way for academic development: CM
content: Pinarayi  urges students to be vigilant against attempts to promote caste-religious enmity and says students should retain their humanity to work for the good of society

title: Parents association hails release of ₹1,200 crore towards fee reimbursements, scholarships
content: They demand State government to release ₹7,000 crore in pending dues under Vidya Deeven and Vasathi Deevena schemes

title: Governor’s address disappointing, no major issue concerning State mentioned: CPI(M)
content: The party State secretary says speech ignored Central dues, Visakhapatnam Steel Plant, Polavaram oustees and ₹1,500 monthly aid to women; alleges over ₹15,000 crore additional power burden on consumers

title: Let routine policing work not suffer because of impending elections in Tamil Nadu, cautions Madras High Court
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh sends across the message during the hearing of a case taken up to prevent reckless riding/driving of motor vehicles on public roads

title: RT mission sets a global model of women empowerment in tourism, says Kerala Tourism Minister
content: Minister was speaking after inaugurating a five-day Kerala Responsible Tourism Festival on Kanakakkunnu Palace grounds in Thiruvananthapuram

title: Academics warn of  deepening crisis in higher education sector in India
content: Former IISc Bengaluru Director flags the growing problem of educated unemployment while speaking at the National Research Conference, which concluded in Thiruvananthapuram

title: Beldanga violence: Was it fair to invoke UAPA, Supreme Court asks NIA
content: Supreme Court orders the NIA to file a status report in the Calcutta High Court in a sealed cover after or during its probe on whether there is prima facie material for a case under the UAPA or not

title: Governor’s address reflects State’s progress under NDA: Health Minister
content: Satya Kumar Yadav says Budget Session speech outlines recovery from previous regime and highlights reforms in health sector under Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu

title: Alliance should last for at least 15 years to ensure a stable government, says Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: There are no differences within the NDA, and it is a good sign, he says, and emphasises that continued unity is a must for development of the State

title: Champ Darnold thanks Seahawks for belief in him
content: Sam Darnold thanked the Seahawks for believing in him as the team celebrated its Super Bowl LX championship at Lumen Field.

title: Parker, EDD, 'Lob City' lead Hall of Fame finalists
content: Candace Parker, Elena Delle Donne, Blake Griffin, A'mare Stoudemire and Doc Rivers are among the finalists for the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame Class of 2026 announced Wednesday.

title: Ex-Jets LB jailed without bond on murder charge
content: A judge on Wednesday kept former Jets first-round draft pick Darron Lee in jail without bond as he faces a first-degree murder charge in the death of his girlfriend.

title: Porter: Roethlisberger 'not a good teammate'
content: Ex-Steelers linebacker and assistant coach Joey Porter Sr. said in a podcast last week that quarterback Ben Roethlisberger wasn't a good teammate or person.

title: Sources: Bassitt joins O's rotation on $18.5M deal
content: Reliable veteran right-hander Chris Bassitt and the Orioles are in agreement on a one-year, $18.5 million contract, sources told ESPN.

title: Hendrick extends Cup champ Larson through '31
content: Two-time NASCAR Cup Series champion Kyle Larson has signed a five-year extension with Hendrick Motorsports through 2031.

title: Sochan waived by Spurs, becomes free agent
content: The Spurs waived Jeremy Sochan on Wednesday, allowing the 2023 All-Rookie team forward to become a free agent.

title: Chock, Bates take 'bittersweet' silver in ice dance
content: American ice dancing stars Madison Chock and Evan Bates delivered a season-best performance Wednesday but fell just short of France's Laurence Fournier Beaudry and Guillaume Cizeron for Olympic gold.

title: 🏆 2026 NFL predictions: Super Bowl, MVP, more
content: Who will win next season's Super Bowl? Who is set to be the next MVP? We asked NFL experts to make early calls on how 2026 will play out.

title: Yates' new NFL mock draft: Predicting all 32 first-round picks -- and two QB landing spots
content: Which teams might take a quarterback? Could offensive linemen dominate the first round? Field Yates projects the top 32 picks of the 2026 NFL draft.

title: Men's Bubble Watch: Miami, TCU, Wisconsin boost résumés; Utah State is now a lock
content: Three ranked upsets lead to big moves in the ACC, Big 12 and Big Ten as the mid-majors get another lock.

title: Women's Power Rankings: A big week for the top of the Big 12
content: Baylor, up five spots in our rankings, is once again atop the Big 12, with WVU, Texas Tech and TCU not far behind.

title: Who wins the Olympic men's hockey tournament? Intel on all 12 countries
content: The NHL is back at the Olympics! Here are the top players to know, each team's medal chances and schedule, and much more.

title: Lapsed fan's guide to the men's hockey tournament
content: Just tuning in to hockey again for the first time in a long time? Get caught up here with all the key intel.

title: 2026 Winter Olympics: Bates and Chock win silver, speedskating gold for Stolz and more
content: On Wednesday at the Winter Olympics, Chloe Kim nailed her debut in Milan Cortina while Evan Bates and Madison Chock earned silver in ice dance free dance.

title: From a 6-foot-7 outfielder to a 5-foot-7 spark plug: One player to watch in spring training for all 30 MLB teams
content: From prospects with big expectations to All-Stars returning from injury, here's who we're paying attention to.

title: Wetzel: Giannis/Kalshi deal does NBA no favors
content: All this might be legal, but at some point perception defines reality and optics overwhelm everything.

title: Six big questions on East playoff race: Does James Harden make Cavs the favorites?
content: It's time for the push to the NBA Finals. Here's how we see the Eastern Conference and what we're watching.

title: No pressure, Arsenal: Man City win big to keep title race alive
content: Manchester City did their job beating Fulham to stay in the Premier League title race, but can Arsenal do the same thing against Brentford?

title: Premier League's 50 worst transfers of all time: Who is No. 1?
content: All right: We've covered the best deals in PL history, but what makes a bad deal? Whatever the reasons behind them, here are the 50 worst since the league began in 1992.

title: 10 teams, 12 quarterbacks, no great options: Sorting the lackluster NFL quarterback market
content: There are no surefire free agent QBs available this March, and the draft class has only one first-round lock. So what now for teams that might need a quarterback?

title: Men's Bracketology: Who's a lock and who's on the bubble?
content: Right now, it's about looking beyond UNC's numbers and taking into account the context that has the Tar Heels as a 4-seed.

title: Women's Bracketology: Bubble trouble for the ACC?
content: The ACC and Big 12 will have a say in the field's final teams. For now, the Last Four In all hail from the ACC.

title: Chris Gotterup's meteoric rise to the top of the PGA Tour
content: Gotterup heads to Pebble Beach as one of the hottest golfers on the PGA Tour, rising all the way to No. 5 in the world golf rankings.

title: How to bet the AT&T Pebble Beach Pro-Am
content: The PGA Tour brings us to Pebble Beach, where looks can be deceiving as far as course difficulty goes.

title: World Baseball Classic odds: Team USA favored over Japan, Dominican Republic
content: Odds for all 20 teams to win their pool group and to win the World Baseball Classic, which begins March 6.

title: How WNBA's expansion Tempo are working to become 'Canada's team' and unify country
content: The Carter effect helped popularize the NBA in Canada. The Tempo hope to similarly supercharge women's basketball.

title: Topps' 75th anniversary set gives fans a chance to pull iconic baseball cards
content: For the 75th anniversary, a panel of executives, journalists and collectors selected the 75 best Topps cards of all time and inserted corresponding redemption cards into their latest release.

title: Myles Garrett on hand to support girlfriend Chloe Kim's Olympic gold medal chase
content: Garrett and Kim had a hilarious debate over which of them was more dominant in their respective sport.

title: Super Bowl runner-up rings: What NFL players really think
content: Some conference championship rings fetch big bucks. Others wind up collecting dust on a closet shelf. Players share mixed opinions on the NFL's sparkly consolation prize.

title: NASCAR descends on Daytona eager to move on from turbulent offseason, get back to racing
content: It was a heartbreaking offseason for much of NASCAR, and as the garage descends on Daytona, the stock car world is ready to refocus on racing.

title: ESPN's first points-league mock draft for 2026
content: Check out the results of our first fantasy baseball head-to-head points mock draft of 2026, featuring round-by-round picks and a snapshot of the rosters of all 10 teams.

title: News or noise: Three fantasy-relevant hitters to have hand surgery
content: Eric Karabell keeps tabs on the baseball world and tells you what is relevant to fantasy baseball managers.

title: Brandon Figueroa rises after upset win over Nick Ball
content: Brandon Figueroa stopped Nick Ball in round 12 to claim the WBA featherweight championship and climb in the rankings. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: Six players whose fantasy value has improved most since the NBA trade deadline
content: A closer look at the players who benefited most from the moves made leading up to last week's NBA trade deadline.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal, Chelsea eye move for Álvarez
content: The two major London clubs are linked with a move with Atlético Madrid's Julián Álvarez. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Bangladesh Election 2026 LIVE: Voting Begins As Bangladesh Decides Its Future Post Sheikh Hasina's Ouster
content: Bangladesh General Election 2026 LIVE Updates: Bangladeshi is voting today in a crucial national election, the first since the July 2024 uprising that ended former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's 15 years of iron-fisted rule.

title: Uttarakhand Court Upholds Compensation Of Rs 29 Lakh For Jawan's Family In Road Death
content: The Uttarakhand High Court has upheld the compensation awarded to the family of an Indian Army soldier who died in a road accident in 2011, dismissing an appeal filed by the Uttar Pradesh State Road Transport Corporation.

title: Hasina, Zia Gone, Bangladesh To Vote In Most Important Polls In Decades Today
content: The polls will be held in the absence of its two most towering political figures, former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, who has been in India since she was deposed in 2024, and Khaleda Zia, who died in December 2025.

title: US House Votes To Reject Trump's Tariffs On Canada
content: The resolution brought by Democrats was approved by a vote of 219 to 211, with six Republicans joining the effort. Even if it passes the US Senate, it would face a likely veto by Trump.

title: "Deeply Sorry": US Attorney General Apologises To Epstein Survivors In Fiery Hearing
content: Attorney General Pam Bondi launched into a passionate defense of President Donald Trump Wednesday as she tried to turn the page from relentless criticism of the Justice Department's handling of the Jeffrey Epstein files.

title: Gates Foundation Says It Did Not Make Any Payments To Epstein
content: The Gates Foundation said on Wednesday it did not make any financial payments to late financier and convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein or employ him at any time.

title: Elon Musk Reorganises xAI After SpaceX Merger
content: Billionaire Elon Musk has overhauled the management of his artificial intelligence startup xAI ahead of a planned initial public offering that could rank among the largest ever, after merging the company with his rocket firm SpaceX.

title: Sabarimala Gold Theft: Ex-Devaswom Board President Gets Bail After 90 Days
content: Former Devaswom Board president N. Vasu was released from the Thiruvananthapuram Special Sub-Jail on statutory bail in connection with the Sabarimala gold theft case.

title: Instagram Denies Addiction Claims In Landmark US Trial
content: Instagram CEO Adam Mosseri on Wednesday rejected the notion that users could be clinically addicted to social media, as he testified in a landmark California trial over whether his company knowingly hooked children on its platform for profit.

title: When Will Ukraine Hold Elections? Zelensky Responds
content: Ukraine will only hold elections once it has security guarantees in place and a ceasefire with Russia, President Volodymyr Zelensky said Wednesday, pushing back at suggestions he was planning to stage fresh ballots under US pressure.

title: 18-Year-Old Identified As Suspect In Canada School Shooting
content: Canadian police on Wednesday said an 18-year-old local resident carried out what Prime Minister Mark Carney called an act of "unheard-of cruelty" in murdering eight people and wounding dozens more in a remote mining town.

title: Dawson's Creek Star James Van Der Beek Dies At 48
content: James Van Der Beek, a heartthrob who starred in coming-of-age dramas at the dawn of the new millennium, shooting to fame playing the titular character in "Dawson's Creek" and in later years mocking his own hunky persona, has died. He was 48.

title: Will Remove Illegal Bangladeshi Hawkers From City Footpaths: Mumbai Mayor
content: Newly anointed Mumbai Mayor Ritu Tawde on Wednesday said removing illegal Bangladeshi hawkers who have encroached upon footpaths, strengthening healthcare, and improving solid waste management will be her key focus areas.

title: Minor Jailed, Misses Board Exams, Administration Says He Was Freed On Time
content: A 17-year-old student in Madhya Pradesh's Shahdol missed his Class 12 English board exam on Tuesday after being jailed as an adult. Satyam Prajapati, a Congress worker, claims he was released only hours before the test began.

title: Trump Says "Insisted" To Netanyahu That Iran Talks Continue
content: US President Donald Trump said Wednesday he told Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu in a meeting at the White House that nuclear talks with Iran must continue.

title: Cops Recover Phone Father Sold Before Suicide Of 3 Daughters In Ghaziabad
content: Police here have recovered a mobile phone that the father of the three sisters, who died by suicide in Ghaziabad, sold to a shopkeeper a fortnight before the horrific incident and sent it for forensic examination, an official said on Wednesday.

title: Delhi Civic Body Removes 380 Unauthorised Banners Ahead Of AI Impact Summit
content: Ahead of the India AI-Impact Summit 2026, the MCD has removed nearly 380 unauthorised banners, hoardings and pole kiosks from several locations as part of an ongoing drive of the corporation to clear public spaces of illegal advertisements

title: Probe Agency ED Summons Amarinder Singh, Son In Money Laundering Case
content: The Enforcement Directorate has summoned former Punjab chief minister Capt Amarinder Singh and his son Raninder Singh for questioning in connection with a Foreign Exchange Management Act (FEMA) violation case.

title: "Blackout Hours" And More Tools In OpenAI's Teen Safety Blueprint For India
content: Asserting that access to safe and trustworthy artificial intelligence is a fundamental right for the first generation coming of age in the "Intelligence Age", OpenAI on Wednesday unveiled a dedicated safety blueprint for Indian teenagers.

title: 'Except Trump, no one said India will stop buying Russian oil': Moscow rejects US claim
content: the TOI Business Desk is a vigilant and dedicated team of journalists committed to delivering the latest and most relevant business news from around the world to readers of the Times of India . the desk ensures that TOI readers are well-informed about the ever-changing and dynamic world of commerce .

title: Red with hues of saffron? Key reasons for Right turn by Kerala's Left
content: Aastha Jha is a writer at The Times of India, covering politics, business and global affairs. She also writes on social issues, with a focus on policy, governance and their impact on everyday lives. Her work brings together reportage and analysis, tracking developments in India and abroad while examining the broader social and economic currents shaping public discourse. Read More

title: War on H-1B: New 'Exile' Bill aims to eliminate visa by next year
content: Lubna Kably is a senior editor, who focuses on various policies and legislation. In particular, she writes extensively on immigration and tax policies. The Indian diaspora is the largest in the world; through her articles she demystifies the immigration-policy related developments in select countries for outbound students, job aspirants and employees. She also analyses the impact of Income-tax and GST related developments for individuals and business entities. Read More

title: Plea in SC for FIR against Assam CM Himanta for hate speech
content: a group of citizens from assam have urged SC through a petition to enforce its order in which it had directed that FIR must be lodged in cases of hate speech . the petitioners alleged that the CM has repeatedly talked about social and economic boycott of Muslim community and addressed them as “Miya” and “Bangladeshi” which are derogatory terms .

title: US chokehold on PM Modi, he has sold India: Rahul Gandhi
content: leader of the opposition accuses the govt of surrendering India’s core data, food and energy interests in the trade deal . he alleged the country had caved in to pressure due to the leverage that the country has over him . his condemnation of the interim pact was the theme of his speech .

title: 'Bengal mein bomb chalta hai': Sitharaman attacks Mamata, refutes TMC claims on Budget
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. title: Rahul Gandhi's accusation against PM Modi on US deal 'blatant lie', says BJP
content: finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman says it was Congress govt who surrendered India's interest before international organisations, including WTO, and "sold" interest of the poor and farmers . she says the uPA had compromised the interest of farmers at Bali on agriculture, and had agreed to the trade facilitation deal .

title: Bangladesh's moment of reckoning: Why India, Pak & China are closely watching Dhaka polls
content: after months of violence, street protests and political upheaval, Bangladesh now faces its moment of reckoning . the unrest left more than 1,000 people dead and dismantled a political order that was entrenched in Dhaka’s politics for over a decade . on february 12, Bangladesh votes in its first general election since that uprising, a ballot that will test not only the strength of its democracy .

title: Fast break: Pair of Kings worth stashing before All-Star break
content: the Detroit Pistons outlasted the Charlotte Hornets in a game defined by chaos and controversy . Isaiah Stewart 's eighth career' penned the latest entry to his résumé, tying Russell Westbrook for the most home triple-doubles in league history . the Thunder exposed the Los Angeles Lakers' inconsistency when they are without Luka Doncic .

title: SC puts on hold advocate's 2 talaq-e-hasan attempts
content: supreme court put on hold advocate's two attempts to divorce his wife through talaq-e-hasan . they sent them to mediation for amicable settlement of their marital dispute . the man had remarried after the first man in 2022 . heena challenged the validity of the pronouncement, which left muslim women destitute .

title: Naravane's book 'leak' bid to bypass defence clearance: Police
content: a pre-print copy of 'Four Stars of Destiny' was allegedly uploaded to .io domain extensions of British Indian Ocean Territory . police are analysing the international standard book number (ISBN), a 13-digit identifier visible on the leaked leaked . the special cell has since added the charge of "hatching a criminal conspiracy" to the FIR .

title: Welcome to the offseason: What you need to know about key dates, biggest questions
content: a third of the NFL could be seeking a new quarterback this offseason . the 2026 draft is projected to be particularly light at the position, and no stars are looming in free agency . teams can begin u.s. games in the coming weeks .

title: What we're most excited to see in 2026: Games, players and more
content: the big Ten has regained its place as the top conference in college football after winning three consecutive national championships . the 2025 college football season culminated with a thrilling College Football Playoff and a national title for undefeated Indiana . it's hard not to look forward to the fall to see what college football does for an encore .

title: Baseball is back! The stars, teams and themes we can't wait to see
content: the new york Mets capped an offseason overhaul with a trade for ace Freddy Peralta . the defending champion los Angeles Dodgers made the biggest splash when they inked no. 1 free agent Kyle Tucker to a four-year, $240 million deal .

title: NBA Power Rankings: Where all 30 teams land heading into All-Star Weekend
content: three teams, made up of american players and international players, go head-to-head in another tournament-style competition . a few new faces have been added to the coveted rosters, including jamal Murray and Chet Holmgren .

title: Tottenham job proved too big for Frank, but changing manager won't fix mess
content: 'FC TV' crew react to the 2-1 defeat to Newcastle united at the st james' stadium in the premier league last summer . the former Brentford manager made it back to the hotel where club officials used it as an example of the step up he had made to Spurs .

title: Tense meetings, 'petty' gripes and inflated egos: Why Jonathan Kuminga and the Warriors had to divorce
content: Shams Charania breaks news that the Warriors are trading Jonathan Kuminga and Buddy Hield to the Hawks in exchange for Kristaps Porzingis . the pair had been eliminated from the NBA Cup two weeks earlier, giving them a rare break in the schedule . they'd won in the previous Sunday night and didn't play again until Friday .

title: Erin Jackson and Brittany Bowe's bond brings them back to the Olympics
content: Brittany Bowe won the 1000-meter race at the Olympic trials in January . the 37-year-old remained the ever-supportive teammate and friend . she won the race by 0.39 seconds, with Bowe's time good enough for second .

title: As PM Modi shifts his office tomorrow, PMO gets a new address: Seva Teerth
content: the first cabinet meeting under PM Jawaharlal Nehru was held in south block . the history of PMO is traced to a small PM's secretariat (PMS) in 1947 . first major structural change happened in 1964, after lal Bahadur Shastri became PM .

title: Reunions, new faces and promotions: Tracking the Power 4 coordinator moves
content: college football's coordinator carousel is often about the next big thing, the name you don't know yet but will soon enough . Chad Morris is back as offensive coordinator at Clemson . he helped engineer the program's rise alongside Dabo Swinney from 2011 to 2014 .

title: Liverpool summon grit, resolve that could carry them to Champions League places
content: liverpool beat sunderland 1-0 at the stadium of light on saturday . the hosts looked set to extend their impressive home record . Virgil van Dijk rising highest to nod home what would be the winning goal .

title: Delhi AQI turns very poor again; scattered rain expected after February 16
content: the air quality index (AQI) stood at 305 at 4pm, up from 271 (poor) at the same time on Tuesday . the last time the city recorded very poor air was on Feb 4, when the AQI was 339 . haziness and changing wind direction could have contributed to the dip in air quality .
